entry.title: Drop unused Header functionality for BaseCarouselSuggestion.
entry.content:
When originally prototyped, we were still experimenting with headers

in Suggestions. The header view was, at the time, part of the

Carousel suggestion, rather than a suggestions section label.



1. This never launched.

2. The labeling mechanism has been replaced with something that can

be server driven -- and is already managed in a different location.



This code serves no purpose.



Change-Id: I37a612d4e2ceac1ff77f2947ea884196df76c172

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4684340

Reviewed-by: Fred Mello

Commit-Queue: Tomasz Wiszkowski

Code-Coverage: Findit

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1170836}

entry.title: [ios] Update ACR fieldtrial testing config
entry.content:
There are new experiment arms in IOSFeedInvisibleForegroundRefresh.gcl

They test our hypothesis that enabling Interactivity Cache will have positive results with ACR.



This CL removes all old testing configs and simplifies it with the

necessary experiment arm configs. (I also learned that you don't need

dates in the titles. Just the configs need to match any arms that you

have in your gcl.)



Change-Id: Ic92321fd301451ba37e376d5eca5141d505c7291

change I'd like to make the existing code here, where the C++

implementation code doesn't quite match the type that the bindings code

expects, not compile.

specification, that this method should also return absl::nullopt in some

cases, though it's not clear to me whether those cases exactly match the

early return near the start of the function. I haven't attempted to

make that behavioral change here.

entry.title: Do not load a new post-commit error page if there is already one pending or active
entry.content:
If a page loads multiple dangerous subresources, multiple error pages

will be triggered one after another, but the user will only see and

interact with the last one. At the time the error page is created,

the SHOW bucket in interstitial.{threat_type}_subresource.decision

histogram is already logged. Multiple SHOW buckets are logged although

users only see one.



In this CL, skip loading a new error page if the current tab already

has a pending error page that is about to be displayed or is actively

displayed.

entry.title: Make PrefetchContainer::Reader separately owned
entry.content:
Instead of keeping only one `PrefetchContainer::Reader` per

`PrefetchContainer` via ``PrefetchContainer::GetReader()`,

this CL makes `PrefetchContainer::Reader` like

`WeakPtr` plus additional states and

owned/plumbed by the `GetReader()` callers.

New non-null `Reader`s are created where needed by

`PrefetchContainer::CreateReader()` or `Reader::Clone()`,

and passed by move-only.



This is preparation for allowing multiple `Reader`s per

`PrefetchContainer`, but in this CL the behavior isn't changed.

In the non-test code, there is essentially only one `Reader`

per `PrefetchContainer` except for some temporary `Reader`s.

entry.title: [EditContext] Make EditContext editability inherited via UserModify
entry.content:
The editability that nodes receive from having an associated EditContext

is currently not inherited. In `HasEditableLevel()` [1] the child

node's default value of EUserModify::kReadOnly will be used instead of

climbing the ancestor chain to find an EditContext on a parent node.



For `contenteditable`, the inheritability is implemented by having

`contenteditable` make the node have -webkit-user-modify:read-write

or read-write-plaintext-only, which is an inherited property. See

`HTMLElement::CollectStyleForPresentationAttribute` [2].



In this CL, we integrate EditContext into that approach. Since

the `editContext` property is not reflected in a content attribute,

it needs to be done a little differently: we use StyleAdjuster to

give the node UserModify if it has an associated EditContext, and

invalidate styles in the `editContext` setter to ensure that this

change is picked up.



[1] https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/blink/renderer/core/editing/editing_utilities.cc;l=182;drc=ecac3938ad3a8c0edd2d1a45c2f9c3c7a7a41c2b

[2] https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/blink/renderer/core/html/html_element.cc;l=331;drc=6bfe7cd47b0de410cc4c90ffbc873ccfc870077d



Bug: 999184

without metadata.

issuer id.

issuer specific histograms for metadata.

entry.title: Refactor clearing previewed elements
entry.content:
This CL:



-Removes early return statements from `(Preview|Fill)FormField` and

moves them to the caller function so that fields added to

`previewed_elements_` are ones that were autofilled.



-Moves the call to ClearPreviewedForm outside the preview conditional

in AutofillAgent::FillOrPreviewForm since the previewed form should be

cleared regardless of whether the new operation is another preview or

the actual filling of the previous preview.



-Makes the function form_util::ClearPreviewedElements act on all the

passed elements in previewed_elements_, whereas before it used to skip

fields because of the first point mentioned.



Bug: 1007974

Change-Id: Ie1731304a9137aea0564a3fa499c146d8c14c961

entry.content:
Presently when a user prints something, the requested print job needs to

match one of the media sizes exactly that the printer supports. Now that

printer capabilities can have custom sizes, update the check so that the

requested media matches a paper size exactly or falls within the custom

size.

entry.title: Video: Add HEVC SVC encode support for macOS 14+ and fix some bug related to HEVC encoding
entry.content:
HEVC SVC support has been added to macOS 14 beta2 and iOS 17 beta2

for Apple Silicon Macs only, so we can adding L1T2 to Chromium.



Unlike H.264, VideoToolbox doesn't provide a software implement for HEVC, so we need to limit HEVC encoding support to HW only.



After adding H.265 to Webcodecs GPU tests, some extra bug was founded.



kVTCompressionPropertyKey_MaxKeyFrameIntervalDuration may suddenly

become unsupported when a second compression session is created if

the codec is H.265 and CPU arch is x64, so we can always check

if the property is supported before setting it.



Also clear the H.265 config arrays when config changed, this will

fix a bug on the bitstream converter which cause writing wrong SPS/PPS/VPS to the description.



Bug: 1379766



Change-Id: I4959547f6a14850e47791d31042f8d2fc4b96537

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4664014

entry.title: [no-vary-search-hint] Add WPT internal test for NVS hint non-eager
entry.content:
Add WPT internal test for No-Vary-Search non eager trigger

functionality.



Use eventSender for now but migrate to test_driver once

crbug.com/1453780 is fixed.



Note: Chrome implementation of `test_driver`, which uses `chrome.gpuBenchmarking.pointerActionSequence`, does not work in a new window opened with `window.open`. I had to use `eventSender` for this scenario and ignored the `eventSender` deprecation message in the presubmit hook.

entry.title: [blink] Fix UAF in NonMainThreadTaskQueue
entry.content:
The issue is that WorkerThreadScheduler::OnTaskCompleted's

PerformMicrotaskCheckpoint() might result in a blink heap GC which may

collect NonMainThreadWebSchedulingTaskQueueImpl (owned by

GarbageCollected) which might own the last ref to

NonMainThreadTaskQueue. If the NonMainThreadTaskQueue is deleted,

there's a UAF in the follow-up call to

task_queue->OnTaskRunTimeReported(task_timing);



Retain a ref to NonMainThreadTaskQueue throughout OnTaskCompleted() to

prevent this.



The other option, proposed @ crbug.com/1464113#c3 was to bind the ref

ahead of time in the `on_task_completed_handler` but I am leery that

this might prevent deleting queues with pending tasks.



R=altimin@chromium.org



Bug: 1464113

entry.title: Reland "iwa: Migrate Storage Partitions GC from Extensions to Web Apps system"
entry.content:
From web-app-internals logs, it seems the previous test failure was due

to GarbageCollectStorageParttionsCommand being scheduled but not run

when the assertion executed in the test.



In this reland, instead of asserting the pref value change, which

happens on command success, we are waiting on the pref value change

using WaitForPrefValue(). This should allow command to execute

successfully. Otherwise, the test will wait until timeout on failure.



This is a reland of commit 3cba199e0ad9052733052a0cf884fc0ef9aae5b0



Original change's description:

> iwa: Migrate Storage Partitions GC from Extensions to Web Apps system

>

> Both Chrome Apps and Isolated Web Apps use isolated Storage Partitions.

> This means any Storage Partition garbage collection system using

> BrowserContext::GarbageCollectStoragePartitions() must be aware of valid

> Storage Partition paths from both systems.

>

> Chrome Apps are being deprecated and IWAs need to work with web app

> command system to avoid race conditions. We are migrating Storage

> Partition garbage collection system from ExtensionsGarbageCollector to

> web_app::GarbageCollectStoragePartitionCommand. The new GC system will

> support Chrome Apps until they are fully removed.

>

> This CL does a few things to fully delete

> ExtensionGarbageCollector::GarbageCollectIsolatedStorageIfNeeded and

> replace it with GarbageCollectStoragePartitionCommand.

>

> For Extensions code:

> - Replace ExtensionsPref::kStorageGarbageCollect with

> pref::kShouldGarbageCollectStoragePartitions

> - Remove

> ExtensionGarbageCollector::GarbageCollectIsolatedStorageIfNeeded and

> its associated InstallGate.

>

> For Web Apps code:

> - Register pref::kShouldGarbageCollectStoragePartitions.

> - Sets prefs::kShouldGarbageCollectStoragePartitions to true in

> remove_web_app_job.cc

> - Register and unregister extensions::InstallGate in

> GarbageCollectStoragePartitionsCommand via ExtensionsManager.

> - Invokes GarbageCollectStoragePartitionCommand in PostProfileInit if

> pref is true.

> - Implicitly call GarbageCollectStoragePartitionCommand from restart

> using PRE test in

> garbage_collect_storage_partitions_command_browsertest.cc

>

> Low-Coverage-Reason:

>

> Change-Id: I5d418dc1b1f7bfc5890850d94d11a827b794b2ff

> Bug: 1453520

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4663920

> Reviewed-by: David Bertoni

> Reviewed-by: Robbie McElrath

> Commit-Queue: Zelin Liu

> Reviewed-by: Daniel Murphy

entry.title: media: Restrict ExternalClearKey on Android by feature flag
entry.content:
ExternalClearKey was showing up on media internals on non test cases on

Android. This was because the UUID was being registered in the key

system UUID map in media_drm_bridge.cc without being guarded by the

media::kExternalClearKeyForTesting flag.



In android_cdm_registration.cc, we called GetPlatformKeySystemNames()

and registered the key systems that were returned with both hardware and

software robustness types in AddOtherAndroidCdms(), which explains why

both robustness types were showing on media internals.



This CL fixes this bug by guarding the addition of the key system

with the aforementioned flag.



Tested by manually running chromium_public_apk on my emulator,previously

on media-internals it was showing the external clear key system

registered, now it does not.



Also added unit tests.



Bug: b/290990246

Change-Id: Id5bb808d949cab8085c3013b7e1e2b9a50dc7832

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4682736

entry.content:
Current tests use the production font server component. If Fuchsia

changes the fonts component implementation in prod, that may break these

tests. This is not a necessary dependency, since these tests don't

verify prod behavior, and can make do with a test-only component.

mechanism. Tests are already providing the required fonts and this

baselines because they should always require `blink/API_OWNERS`

approval to change. Block virtual->nonvirtual deduplication while

preserving deduplication by platform by adding a sentinel node to the

optimization graph between the two trees.

entry.title: Revert "Metrics Logging - Enable Network Time Tracker"
entry.content:
This reverts commit f13743d651fc40015d1be01dd0e66a33192d82fc.



Reason for revert:

http://crbug.com/1463914



Original change's description:

> Metrics Logging - Enable Network Time Tracker

>

> The framework to use network time tracker in metrics logging was landed

> in a disabled form in

> https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/3032615/

> At that time, compiling in network time tracker caused errors on

> certain Android bots. These errors came from a library brought in

> through transitive includes from webm. Those errors in webm have

> now been cleaned up.

>

> In the process of enabling the network time tracker, fix a bug exposed by tests:

>

> The creation of NetworkTimeTracker in BrowserProcessImpl::PreMainMessageLoopRun() was guarded by the feature flag network_time::kNetworkTimeServiceQuerying. This guard didn't do much, as a NetworkTimeTracker would be created automatically the first time it was accessed. (This use was unguarded.) This change removes the guard.

>

> (I considered applying the guard consistently everywhere, but it seems many tests rely on having an existing NetworkTimeTracker, even one that doesn't run queries for remote times. Removing the guard is the simplest way to keep the status quo. If someone wants later to guard all creations and fix all the test assumptions, that can be done elsewhere.)

>

> Bug: 1257449,1278829

> Change-Id: I2d63bfdf0b0b08196f870c999443b644953adbd4

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/3322058

> Reviewed-by: Emily Stark

> Reviewed-by: Luc Nguyen

> Reviewed-by: Tommy Nyquist

> Commit-Queue: Mark Pearson

> Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1167657}

entry.title: [iOS] Replace CHECKs and DCHECKs with TODOs in coordinators
entry.content:
This CL replaces failing CHECKs and DCHECKs in coordinators that have

been crashing with TODOs. The failing CHECKs and DCHECKs are caused by a

race condition or by a multi-selection of table view cells (see

crbug.com/1464966 for more info), and can be reproduced pretty much

everywhere in Settings. We'll have to come up with a general fix for

this issue. Until then, we want to get rid of the noise by removing the

checks that are known to have generated crash reports. We know about

the issue and the app still functions when those checks fail.

entry.title: Print Preview: Fix page size calculations
entry.content:
After https://crrev.com/1160870 changed the page layout to use floats on

the C++ side, the TS code that consumes the values needs to be adjusted.



Currently, the margins are being rounded and then added to the content

area. For example, if the page layout contains:



marginLeft = 28.333

marginRight = 28.333

contentWidth = 555.333



then the current code will calculate a page width of 611.333. Not only

is this off by a non-trivial amount, but it also passes an unexpected

non-integer page dimension back to the C++ code in doPrint().



To fix this, stop rounding the margins and round the page size instead.

With the example above, the page width will be 612 again.



Bug: 1463904

Change-Id: I77c0c92c3440e8a4fb93b1685eb3391c87986a62

entry.title: refactor: SyntheticGesture holds params.
entry.content:
This is a non-functional refactor from https://crrev.com/c/4666793.



This CL makes the SyntheticGesture base class hold the pointer to the

gesture params, rather than having each descendant class storing its own

pointer. This makes it more straightforward to access common params in a

gesture-agnostic way, as was needed by the above CL.



However, since each gesture takes its own type of params, all derived

from SyntheticGestureParams, there's some hoops to jump through with

type conversions. A new intermediate base class is introduced, templated

on the final type, to avoid type conversion boilerplate in each derived

class.

entry.title: FLEDGE: Handle timeout when converting arguments to setBid
entry.content:
We needed to explicitly grant v8 permission to interrupt the

conversion ops with a SafeForTerminationScope, and then to be

careful not to turn that termination into a regular exception.



Other APIs with complex types will likely need similar work;

filed https://crbug.com/1464976 about it (and CC'ing that to add context there).

entry.title: Make GPUUncapturedErrorEvent::error non-const to match IDL semantics.
entry.content:
This changes GPUUncapturedErrorEvent::error to have a non-const return

value, to match the semantics of WebIDL, where the return value is not

const. It correspondingly changes it to be a non-const method.



I believe this sort of code *should* be a compilation error, and I have

work in progress on a CL to the bindings code to make it one. This is

one of two const-related changes in blink that needs to be made for that

CL. (There are other type-related changes.)

entry.title: media/gpu: Allow non-coherent buffers in legacy V4L2 decoder
entry.content:
Allocate V4L2 output buffers as non-coherent when we are using MT21

software decompression. This reduces the latency of decompressing a

frame by about 10ms since it enables CPU caching.

entry.title: Make blink image decoders use ImageOrientationEnum
entry.content:
There is a goal of moving blink::ImageDecoder or roughly

third_party/blink/renderer/platform/image-decoders/. This code uses

blink::ImageOrientation, which has other blink dependencies, when it

really only needs to use blink::ImageOrientationEnum. Switch image

decoders to use the enum instead since that will be easier to move

outside blink.

entry.title: Load new quick app icon when icon version changes
entry.content:
After requesting LoadIcon(), a placeholder icon can be returned while the actual icon is still being downloaded. When the download finishes,

the app list item has its icon version incremented.



To update to the new icon used by the app item, call LoadIcon() again

after icon version change.

entry.title: [dPWA] App identity update dialog knows when uninstall is scheduled
entry.content:
Previously, on clicking the uninstall button in the app identity

dialog, the uninstall dialog would show up, and confirming uninstall

would not actually close the update dialog. This is because the callback to close the dialog is passed into the bowels of the uninstall command which gets scheduled but does not run, since it needs an AllAppsLock, and the current app update dialog is a part of a command that is holding an apps lock.



This CL rewires the behavior by triggering the closing of the app

update dialog as SOON as the uninstall is scheduled, leading to the

app update dialog auto closing and passing the correct user choice as

a manifest update result and ending the manifest update process earlier, reducing a lot of redundant commands being scheduled and run. This inadvertantly fixes crbug.com/1378271 as well.



Investigation: go/update-blocks-uninstall



Bug: b/245970599, crbug.com/1378271

Change-Id: I7161921ad0a7bd3be36b1fdc25d58ef4d81a2222

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4685051

entry.title: Offset MenuListOption bounds by window's scroll values
entry.content:
Currently, the popup's owner select element's window's scroll values are

not taken into consideration when computing the bounding rects for

MenulistOptions, which causes the wrong values to be exposed when a

select element is outside of the initial visual viewport. This change

takes into account the window scroll values and offsets the

MenulistOptions position accordingly.

entry.title: [ios] Only update NTPTabHelper _active when setting valid delegate
entry.content:
Updating _active when setting the NTPTabHelper's delegate to nil

is an issue if the user cancels a navigation away from the NTP before

it finishes, returning the WebState's GetVisibleURL() back to

chrome://newtabpage (e.g the last committed nav item). Since there

is currently no response action for a cancelled page load, the NTP logic

still believes that this tab does not have a presented NTP. However,

when the user then closes this tab after cancelling the load,

NTPTabHelper->IsActive() is YES, so the NTP is given a

-didNavigateAwayFromNTP signal, and since the NTP doesn't know the

load was cancelled, its _webState is nil since it believes the

currently shown tab is not presenting an NTP. Thus, update logic in

-didNavigateAwayFromNTP that uses _webState crashes.



Not updating _active when setting a nil delegate resolves this

misaligned state, but not issue of the NTP not being aware that

the load was cancelled and now the currently committed URL is the

NTP.



Bug: 1449615

Change-Id: Ia11bd49daef84a153a205bd9f75699e876ea6839

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4687977

Reviewed-by: Adam Arcaro

entry.content:
This CL makes `PrefetchStreamingURLLoader` OnReceivedHead

callback point to `PrefetchContainer::OnReceivedHead()`,

and migrates the OnReceivedHead callback users to

This removes the hack in

`PrefetchContainer`, to make upcoming refactoring easier.

entry.title: personalization: dom-if for `google-photos-collections`
entry.content:
In the wallpaper subpage, both dom-if and hidden are used for this

element, which makes it hard to reason when the element is visible, and

unnecessarily increases the dom size. This CL removes hidden attribute

completely in favor of dom-if.



Move `fetchGooglePhotosEnabled()` call to `wallpaper-collections`

element since the enablement state is needed to render the Google Photos

tile.



Also simplify `google-photos-collections` by removing the custom

externally resolvable promise and using the observer

`onPathOrEnabledChanged_` instead to check when it's safe to fetch

photos and albums.



BUG=b:290973097

entry.title: Roll out version 5 of the Android RT check allowlist
entry.content:
As part of the newly launched component updater real time allowlist

mechanism on Android, we can rollout new versions of the allowlist

without users waiting for new Chrome builds. By updating the asciipb

file, we can verify the changes on Canary and (if they're valid) roll

out the new allowlist contents to all users.

entry.title: Reuse PrintAndWaitUntilPreviewIsReadyAndLoaded() more in tests
entry.content:
Currently, several PrintBrowserTest test cases do not use

PrintAndWaitUntilPreviewIsReadyAndLoaded(), and re-implement it simply

because PrintAndWaitUntilPreviewIsReadyAndLoaded() does not return the

newly created Print Preview dialog. Tweak

PrintAndWaitUntilPreviewIsReadyAndLoaded() to return the dialog and

simplify these tests.



As a result of this change, the only caller to

TestPrintPreviewObserver::ResetForAnotherPreview() has been removed. So

remove this method as well.



Fix some lint errors along the way.

entry.title: Convert some methods to use null pointers rather than absl::optional.
entry.content:
These methods implement nullable getters for IDL. The bindings code

expects that types (such as pointers) that have a null value use that

null value to represent the null result, rather than using

absl::optional.



As part of type checking the return types used by the bindings code, I'd

like to make code prior to this change a compilation error. I have a CL

to do so; this is a dependency of that change. These webcodecs changes

are the only dependency that fixes this particular pattern of using

absl::optional around a nullable type.



Bug: 1464089

entry.title: Try to deflake two fast/forms/number web tests
entry.content:
The two tests have flaky failures where certain hover styles are not

shown, which I suspect is due to test finishing too early before the

last frame update. So this patch uses runAfterLayoutAndPaint() to delay

test finish and hopefully fix the flakes.



If this patch works, I'll remove the flaky test expectations in

another patch.

entry.title: Add null check for PerformanceTiming before referencing.
entry.content:
Crash is reported at the place when PerformanceTiming is dereferenced.

See bug for details.



The PerformanceTiming could be nullptr if the Performance object

initiating it is a WorkerPerformance. In the crash report, the stack

trace shows the Performance::Mark task is posted to a worker.



Previous there was a null check for PerformanceTiming. It was removed

in CL https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/3656547 somehow.



Bug: 1458578

entry.title: Don't expose a getter for ThreadState::isolate_
entry.content:
Two of the three current uses are trivial to remove. The only

complex use is in ActiveScriptWrappableBase, where we need to

plumb an ExecutionContext's isolate pointer to

RegisterActiveScriptWrappable().



ThreadState still needs to hold a pointer to the isolate_ for

cleanup and testing purposes, but this ensures that we're not

referencing thread-wide state unnecssarily.
